838980923:
[

Senior UX Designer

Company Name REA Group Company Location Richmond, Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 50 views

Be an early applicant

Job description



  • Explore how people think and why they think that way
  • Facilitate and drive collaboration across different teams
  • Help drive much needed innovation in the Australian Rent market


We are an Australian-based digital media company with a passion for real estate.

Our leading brand is Australia's biggest property resource, realestate.com.au. We also operate the number one commercial property site, realcommercial.com.au, and have businesses that help property developers and other brands advertise with us. Whilst we live in Australia, we've also got ventures in Asia and North America, and have the vision of expanding our footprint further.

What it's like to work for us…
Our people are our greatest asset. Without them, we would not be the successful business that we are today. That's why we offer a range of benefits to ensure we hire and retain great staff.
We offer:

  • An annual reward and recognition program for staff who are kicking goals throughout the year
  • Onsite health and wellbeing programs, including boxing, yoga and meditation classes, a relaxation pod and weekly massages
  • A day off for volunteer leave, to ensure you have the opportunity to give back to your community.
  • An Employee Community Grants program to show you that we care about your community just as much as you do
  • Quarterly Hack Days so you can bring your ideas to life


What you will be doing…
 As Senior UX Designer, you work within our Rent Product team, to help them reimagine the way the rental world works in Australia. Specifically, you'll focus on our customer, Property Managers, and lead the design of the tools and products that they use. Day to day you can expect to:

  • Solve real problems for Property Managers in a complex, three-sided market
  • Build relationships with real estate agents and Conduct User research to shape usability and feed into the Strategy
  • Produce conceptual sketches through to high fidelity mockups
  • Work in an Agile product squad to release incremental updates
  • Have plenty of variety, no two days are the same!



What we're looking for…
 In our Rent team, you'll develop a deep understanding of the challenges that Property Managers face and, through collaboration within the product and design teams, help us solve these problems for them.
To do this, we need someone who can (hint: you might want to make sure this is on your resume):

  • Display a portfolio that speaks to delivering business value
  • Bring experience from working on large consumer products
  • Demonstrate strong experience in all aspects of UX Design
  • Live and breathe collaboration. It is something that comes very naturally to you and you are often referred to as the glue of the team/the person that nurtures out the best ideas from other people
  • Adapt and thrive in an evolving environment



But we don't just look for someone based on their skills and expertise. We need someone who is going to fit in with the team and company culture. That means you also need to be:

  • Savvy minded and have the ability to think a little left of field / outside the box
  • A strong and creative communicator
  • Digitally savvy (being a tech company, we need to know that you love all things tech)
  • Friendly, approachable and have good relationship management skills



If you like the sound of us, then we think you should throw your hat in the ring. While we take a look at your application, we encourage you to get to know us a bit more through our various social channels.

Seniority Level

Mid-Senior level

Industry

  • Online Media

Employment Type

Full-time

Job Functions

  • Design
]

839187975:
[

People and Culture Business Partner

Company Name Latitude Financial Services Company Location 800 Collins St, Docklands, VIC 3008, AU

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 170 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

The Opportunity

\xa0

We are looking for an experienced People & Culture Business Partner to join our team to play a crucial role in supporting a number of our key executive team members and their business groups. The P&C BP is both strategic and hands-on and provides full HR life-cycle partnering as well as support on our initiatives around driving a highly engaged, customer obsessed culture as well as building the capability for the future.


Reporting to the People & Culture Director, you will partner with an extremely ‘people focused’ leader, immersing yourself in the business unit, taking an active role in the Leadership teams to advise and link People & Culture to the broader business strategy.


As a strategic partner, you will utilise your excellent relationship skills, trust and emotional intelligence to develop and implement people initiatives whilst providing great internal support to drive HR functional excellence and process improvement. You will also work collaboratively with the wider People Team (Org Capability, Talent, Communications, Reward & Systems, and People Operations) to align and deliver on our strategic priorities in achieving a great place to work and a best in class employee experience.


Working closely with our Organisation Capability team, you will design and implement talent management strategies across your business groups including identification and development of high performing employees and building our organisational capability.

\xa0

Who you are

\xa0

You are a seasoned HR Generalist with a several years’ experience in multiple HR Disciplines (Rem & Ben, recruitment & selection, organisation development, org design, workforce planning) who is ready to bring your skills to challenge the status quo and identify opportunities to innovate in all areas relating to people.


You have had experience with end to end performance management and have sound knowledge of legalities relating to people. You love to roll up your sleeves and be amongst the action, it is what ignited your passion for HR and you are excited to get involved with the hard work involved in supporting our journey.


You enjoy a fast-paced/high change environment, where you commit to delivering on promises and getting things done. You thrive on the ability to translate a strategy into plan which result in tangible outcomes. You would describe yourself as a chameleon, being able to shift your language and approach to that of each business unit, allowing you to understand their challenges and build people solutions to mitigate these.


Most of all you are down to earth, approachable and genuine. You are always happy to help your peers and enjoy coaching and mentoring those around you.

It would be a bonus if you have experience partnering with a Technology business, Workday HRIS, and working in an Agile environment.


What are the perks?
At Latitude, we offer a competitive salary, flexible working arrangements, a diverse range of benefits, 5 – week annual leave program, health and wellbeing activities and so much more. Our new offices in Docklands are cutting edge with subsidised cafe, games rooms, awesome customer focused collaboration spaces and all the tools to enable your success.

\xa0

About Us
We are a growing consumer finance business with 2000 employees. We are the challenger brand in the market with high aspirations to make a difference; committed to creating great customer experiences and obsessed by better outcomes every day. Our business model includes a growing Direct- to- Consumer business in both personal lending and credit cards, as well as a partnership model for white label lending and credit cards. We are in the process of transforming our business, placing our customers at the centre of everything we do. It’s an exciting time to be a part of Latitude Financial Services.

\xa0

Note: You must be a Permanent Resident of Australia or an Australian or New Zealand Citizen to be considered for this role. Successful applicants will be required to complete a background check (including criminal history and bankruptcy check) prior to commencement of employment.

Job description

David Jones wants to inspire people by providing an exceptional experience. As one of the leading international retailers, we’ve done this by curating the world's leading brands across fashion, beauty, home and food. By enabling and empowering our employees, David Jones ensures that we are a destination for endless possibilities.


Be part of a world class merchandise team who bring together the best in Australian and international brands across fashion, beauty and home.


The Merchandise Group is responsible for ensuring that our range and selection continues to remain fresh and relevant to our customers. The team is committed to delivering the very best range of brands and exclusives, across David Jones at competitive prices to enhance the customer's experience.


In this role you will:


  • Place replenishment orders in line with the documented order schedule
  • Reviewing daily orders and manage exceptions as per the guideline

839565169:
[

Brand Manager, Innovation - Global Wellness

Company Name Swisse Wellness Company Location Collingwood

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 194 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Longing for a career, not a job, working with a team of people who are dedicated to creating premium quality, scientifically validated natural health products and love making people healthier and happier?


Swisse Wellness could be it!


With over 40 years' experience in the Wellness sector, we are a leading Wellness brand in Australia who currently employee over 300 team members globally. From our vitamins and supplements, to our superfoods, sports nutrition and skincare ranges, when you work for Swisse, you are working across multiple wellness categories, full of premium quality products all formulated to help our customers "Celebrate Life Every Day"!


Our people are the reason we succeed. That’s why they’re our first priority. This informs our culture which is grounded in the belief that if we focus on\xa0PEOPLE,\xa0PRINCIPLES\xa0and\xa0PASSION,\xa0then\xa0PROFIT\xa0will naturally follow.


Our team members love the on-site gym, daily meditation class, flexible working hours, provided team lunches, breakfasts and healthy snacks, ‘CLED’ card rewards, global career opportunities and so much more!


Learn more about life at Swisse on our\xa0LinkedIn Page.


THE ROLE:


  • Drive and develop consumer insight-led, strategic innovation across key product categories for global markets
  • Lead a robust portfolio of innovation projects end-to-end, working with key business functions to bring ideas from concept through to commercial launch

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:


  • Leverage global trends, consumer insight and competitive analysis to inform strategic innovation planning across key product categories globally, and to identify novel opportunities for growth
  • Drive and contribute actively to global and local ideation workshops with senior internal and external stakeholders, including key ingredient suppliers, to identify, prioritise and progress new opportunities
  • Lead cross-functional teams across R&D, Product Development, Marketing, Quality, Regulatory, Packaging, Sales, Finance and Operations, to deliver NPD on time and in line with organisational goals and targets
  • Develop sharp and compelling innovation business cases capturing consumer, market, commercial and scientific data to present to the Executive team for approval and sign-off through our monthly Global Innovation Stage and Gate process
  • Work closely with regional teams to ensure all global innovation addresses the needs of all regions
  • Work closely with Sales, Marketing and Operations teams to develop successful go-to-market and launch plans across all key channels and markets as well as the development of suite of assets to support the launch\xa0
  • Input into life-cycle management of innovation portfolio through the regular review of sales, margins and the competitive space

EXPERIENCE\xa0AND SKILLS:


  • Degree in Marketing, Business or related field, with very strong Strategy, Innovation Development and Project Management skills
  • 5+ years experience in FMCG or similar, managing Innovation in a marketing-led context
  • Knowledge of key ingredients in the health and wellness space and their functionality is desired, but not essential
  • Experience with Innovation Stage and Gate process desirable
  • Creative and innovative in generating ideas and finding solutions to challenges
  • Strategic thinker, who can see the bigger picture and bring together trends, insights, scientific and commercial data, to develop high quality innovation from inception through to launch
  • Ability to develop sharp and compelling presentation decks for the most senior audiences and deliver at an exceptionally high standard
  • Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and to navigate complex change
  • Comfortable working in a cross-cultural environment and highly respectful of others
  • Excellent project management skills and ability to manage multiple projects at various stages of progress
  • Ability to work across cross-functional units and manage varying priorities and stakeholders
  • Ability to analyse and interpret key information, including market and financial data
  • Collaborative by nature, with a strong sense of teamwork
  • Excellent verbal and written communication to all levels, with experience presenting to senior audiences

Of vital importance is that you will be a solutions-orientated and self-motivated person who will possess an abundance of positivity, initiative and a passion for making People Healthier and Happier as well as demonstrate Swisse Wellness Team Spirit to "Celebrate Life Every Day!


Does this role sound perfect for you? If so, please 'Apply Now' by submitting your cover letter and CV to the Swisse team.

Seniority Level

Associate

Industry

  • Health, Wellness and Fitness
  • Consumer Goods
  • Pharmaceuticals

Employment Type

Full-time

Job Functions

  • Marketing

Project Delivery Manager - Business Transformation

Company Name BP Company Location Melbourne CBD, Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 115 views

Be an early applicant

Job description


About Us


GBS Australia and NZ is a provider of a broad range of integrated customer solutions, supporting BP's operations across Australia and New Zealand. Supporting both BP and Castrol brands, our services include accounting and banking operations, logistics/scheduling operations, customer service and sales, credit management, financial reporting and HR Services. GBS ANZ has positioned itself as the true leader in a highly competitive shared services landscape.


As part of the BP group of companies with operations in over 100 countries, GBS ANZ sits within a global organisation supporting BP Australia's businesses of exploration, production, refining, trading and distribution of energy.


About the opportunity


GBS is embarking on a global programme to Modernise and Transform. As part of this GBS ANZ will be leading in shaping the programme that we will then roll out to the other GBS Centres globally. It will be a fundamental shift in thinking and ways of working within GBS and our Downstream businesses.


In this contract role to December 2019, you will be responsible for the delivery of the End to End Process Transformation programme initiatives and the delivery of key strategic projects for Australia and New Zealand.

  • Work closely with the Transformation Manager to identify end to end process opportunities to modernise and transform.
  • Define project scope, goals and deliverables that support business goals in collaboration with senior management and stakeholders
  • Develop full-scale project plans and schedule project timelines and milestones using appropriate tools
  • Monitor and control the quality management process, manage expectations, conduct milestone reviews, manage process performance, and partner with Continuous Improvement
  • Develop and deliver progress reports, proposals, requirements documentation, and presentations
  • As guided, setup governance with the right members to ensure strong governance and escalation points


About you

  • Extensive Project Management experience and track record of bottom line delivery
  • Proven track record of the delivery of business transformation programs
  • Experience of working in fast-paced, high-demand, delivery oriented environments
  • Experience managing delivery of business cases by monitoring costs and value delivered and intervening with corrective action when necessary to achieve commercial outcomes
  • Ability to build relationships with internal and external stakeholders in order to deliver mutually beneficial outcomes, deal with ambiguity, navigate complexity and drive impactful outcome
  • Certified in Project Management and/or Six Sigma Master Black Belt and a practitioner of Agile methodology is desirable


About the benefits


We can offer you a vibrant, collaborative work culture and a company that lives and breathes its values of Safety, Respect, Excellence, Courage and One Team. We have a commitment to developing your career and reward our people with a competitive package and flexible working conditions coupled with benefits that reflect these values.

Associate

Industry

  • Oil & Energy
  • Retail

Employment Type

Full-time

  • Project Management

841005769:
[

Compliance Analyst

Company Name ThinkMarkets Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 59 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

ThinkMarkets is seeking an ambitious Analyst to join our global Compliance department. Reporting into the Senior Compliance Officer, you will be responsible for overlooking and guiding legal services for the company and affiliates. The role will serve as a legal advisor to the senior leadership. The successful candidate will be expected to provide a proactive approach to solving legal issues within a dynamic and growing organization. The position requires significant interaction with clients and other external constituents. The position ensures the Organization is in compliance with the rules and regulations of the regulatory agencies, that company policies and procedures are being followed, and that behavior in the organization meets the company’s Standards of Conduct.


Requirements: \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0

\xa0

  • Maintain awareness of the legislation and regulation affecting Financial Services.
  • Review Financial Promotions, including sales, marketing, technical literature, telesales scripts, and websites.
  • Audit departments carrying out regulated activities to ensure compliance with agreed procedures.
  • Assist in the completion of reports to the ASIC.
  • Produce relevant Management Information.
  • Assist in the production of communications to increase the regulatory knowledge and skills within the ThinkMarkets Group.
  • Work with the Senior Compliance Officer on managing and creating internal policies and procedures.
  • Assist the Senior Compliance Officer in providing regulatory policy advice to internal departments.
  • Monitor various compliance activities within the ThinkMarkets Group against the Compliance Monitoring Plan and to provide a full Gap Analysis report.
  • Assist in maintaining ThinkMarkets’ data protection safeguards by providing detailed and accurate advice.
  • Assist in maintaining ThinkMarkets’ regulatory safeguards against the risks of money laundering and terrorist financing.
  • Assist in the production of training and communications to increase the regulatory knowledge and skills within ThinkMarkets.
  • Analyse Management Information coming into the department to assist in targeting the Compliance Monitoring Plan.
  • Represent the Compliance function in internal meetings.
  • Other compliance-related tasks and projects, as required.

\xa0


Qualifications:

\xa0

  • Bachelor's degree in Fnance or Economics.
  • Experience in share trading and brokerage operations is a must.
  • RG146 compliance training.
  • Mandarin language skills would be advantageous.
  • Previous experience in Compliance Monitoring and regulations.
  • Experience within a Financial Services organization or equivalent.
  • Strong analytical skills to use data/metrics for risk monitoring.
  • Good MS Office skills.
  • Excellent communications and presentation skills (written and verbal).
  • Strong organizational skills to allow effective management of programs/deliverables.
  • Self-motivated, good organizational skills, detail-oriented, ability to prioritize, multi-task and meet deadlines.
  • Thinking analytically - being able to understand complex technical information and to apply this understanding to a variety of different scenarios.
  • Displaying confidence and professionalism - demonstrating a sound knowledge of the regulation relating to the ASIC, Anti-Money Laundering regime, Data Protection, and the financial services industry.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills, with an ability to explain complex technical information clearly and accurately for different levels of staff.
  • Sound ability to solve problems and resolve inquiries.
  • Excellent attention to detail.
  • Organisation – being able to prioritize and manage own work.
